As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs or biases, but I can suggest some general tips to avoid logical fallacies in arguments:

1. Educate yourself on logical fallacies - Familiarize yourself with common logical fallacies so you can recognize them in your arguments and others' arguments.

2. Use reliable sources - Use reliable and credible sources of information to back up your arguments.

3. Check your emotions - Try to keep emotions out of the debate as they may lead to biased thinking or the use of ad hominem arguments.

4. Listen to opposing viewpoints - Listen to opposing viewpoints carefully and try to understand them instead of dismissing them outright.

5. Stay focused on the issue at hand - Stay focused on the topic being discussed and avoid diverting attention to irrelevant matters.

6. Back up your claims - Back up your claims with evidence and avoid making broad generalizations.

7. Practice critical thinking - Develop your critical thinking skills to evaluate arguments and statements effectively.

8. Avoid false analogies - Avoid making false comparisons, and ensure that your analogies are relevant and accurate. 

9. Do not make hasty generalizations - Avoid making too-broad generalizations based on limited evidence or a single occurrence.

10. Keep an open mind - Be open-minded and willing, if the evidence demands, to abandon or re-think some of your preconceived ideas.
